answers.answer: What you describe sounds like you are having post-nasal drip .  If that is the case a “cheap” and often effective treatment would be what are called nasal washes or nasal irrigations with normal saline (saltwater solution).Now that you have quit smoking, I urge you to never smoke again.  Also one month of smoking cessation is a short period of time to expect improvement in the mucous and you might want to wait another month or two before deciding that smoking cessation is not the answer.Your dry nose and “feel like thirsty for water” could be signs of another disease such as diabetes.  You should definitely have this checked out by your doctor.Good luck
